title: Sam Curran joins the pod! The allrounder talks IPL, Surrey captaincy and cricket rivalry in the Curran family
description: Nasser and Athers are joined by Sam Curran who looks ahead to another IPL with Chennai Super Kings and discusses what it's like to play alongside MS Dhoni. He also talks about captaining Surrey, playing for England, and the cricketing success of his whole family.Make sure you don't miss an episode of the Sky Sports Cricket Podcast by giving this show a follow wherever you get your podcasts.

title: ICC Champions Trophy: What next for England and semi finals preview
description: Nas and Ath are in Dubai and are joined by 'friend of the pod', Dinesh Karthik (DK), to look back on England's exit from the tournament and look ahead to India versus Australia, and South Africa against New Zealand in the semi finals of the Champions Trophy. You can follow both matches across Sky Sports.

title: You scratch your back, I'll scratch mine

author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: The Shark Sized Banana
description: A preview of the most pointless thing we‚Äôve ever ignored, Mattchin‚Äôs Greatest Ever Quiz, Jimmy has a special present for Greg and we don our monocles and top hats as we head once again to ‚ÄôThe Tat Modern‚Äô. Plus what next for England‚Äôs ODI side, The Hundred draft and Indie News.
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: Rob Key on England‚Äôs Men‚Äôs Cricket
description: Mark Chapman is joined by Michael Vaughan, Jimmy Anderson and England men‚Äôs managing director Rob Key. They talk about where England‚Äôs men‚Äôs cricket is at the moment ‚Äì what‚Äôs next? How will England look to change the picture across the board? And what will the process be to replace Jos Buttler as white-ball captain?
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: Incredible India win Champions Trophy & Rob Key reacts to England‚Äôs woes
description: Simon Mann presents reaction to India beating New Zealand and winning the 2025 Champions Trophy. He‚Äôs alongside England World Cup winner Alex Hartley, the BBC‚Äôs chief cricket commentator Jonathan Agnew & Indian commentator Prakash Wakankar.Hear from India‚Äôs winning captain Rohit Sharma, as well as Virat Kohli. Plus, player of the tournament New Zealand‚Äôs Rachin Ravindra.Also, the managing director of England Men‚Äôs Cricket Rob Key looks back on England‚Äôs poor Champions Trophy performance and gives an insight into the process for selecting the next white ball captain after Jos Buttler‚Äôs resignation.
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: IPL preview, WPL review & how to fix your cricket bat
description: This week‚Äôs Stumped with Nikesh Rughani, Jim Maxwell and Sunil Gupta is an Indian T20 franchise special.The 18th edition of the Indian Premier League starts on 22 March, and the team discuss the major talking points heading into the tournament, including Kolkata Knight Riders selecting Ajinkya Rahane as captain and if this could be the year for Virat Kohli's RCB to win their first title?We reflect on Mumbai Indians winning the Women‚Äôs Premier League for the second time in three years.Plus, we chat to cricket bat restorer Barney Morris about the rare and growing trade in cricket bat repairs. Photo: Players of Kolkata Knight Riders celebrate with the trophy after their victory against the Sunrisers Hyderabad in the 2024 IPL Final match between the Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad at MA Chidambaram Stadium on May 26, 2024 in Chennai, India. (Photo by Pankaj Nangia/Getty Images)
author: BBC World Service

title: Can India's men dominate white ball cricket for a decade?
description: On this week's Stumped, Alison Mitchell, Brett Sprigg and Charu Sharmu discuss India‚Äôs dominance of the men‚Äôs white ball game - will it continue all the way through to next year‚Äôs T20 World Cup and beyond? It‚Äôs after India added the Champions Trophy to the T20 World Cup they won in Barbados last year. Virat Kohli reckons this current squad has enough talent to "take on the world" for the next eight years. We speak to Cricket Australia‚Äôs outgoing Chief Executive Nick Hockley. He‚Äôs standing down at the end of this month after five years in charge. He tells us the controversial resignation of men‚Äôs Test captain Tim Paine was one of the most challenging periods of his tenure, but that he and Paine have since spent a lot of time together and he backs him to have a long and successful coaching career.He also told us he believes support for the Afghanistan women‚Äôs team will continue after his departure and that the controversial decision to mark 150 years of England against Australia with a day/night game can celebrate the history of the game whilst also nodding to the future.Plus, we look at what Harry Brook‚Äôs decision to withdraw from the upcoming Indian Premier League means for him and England.Photo: Virat Kohli of India and teammate Rohit Sharma celebrate following the team's victory in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 Final between India and New Zealand at Dubai International Stadium on March 09, 2025 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. (Credit: ICC via Getty Images)
author: BBC World Service

title: Jamie Overton 'Mankad's Kiwi batter but doesn't appeal in 'heated' BBL confrontation
description: England all-rounder Jamie Overton attempted to 'Mankad' New Zealand international Finn Allen in a BBL clash between Adelaide Strikers and Perth Scorchers today on New Year's Eve, leading to an on-field spat between the two.

title: Planet Dhoni
description: A preview of the richest, craziest, noisiest and longest cricket show on earth - the IPL 2025. Simon Hughes, Simon Mann and Indian commentator Deep Dasgupta discuss the intricacies of the tournament, marvel at MS Dhoni's longevity, ask whether this could finally be RCB/Virat Kohli's year and assess the likely fortunes of the ten English players involved. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

title: The Young Ones
description: There is a 13 year old (possible) debutant in the IPL (Vaibhav Suryavanshi). A 20 year old Ashes debutant, leg spinner Mason Crane, reflects on handling the pressure when young and how powerful Shane Warne's influence on him still is. We reflect on pre-season training in March, mad playing colleagues and the rumoured Saudi Arabian T20 league. For more insightful cricket content subscribe to The Cricverse blog at https://cricverse.substack.com/p/because-youre-worth-it?r=lo2wd Learn more about your ad choices. title: Jon Lewis sacked as England Women‚Äôs head coach after ill-fated Ashes tour
description: Lewis took charge of the team back in November 2022England whitewashed 16-0 by Australia during AshesJon Lewis has been let go as England Women‚Äôs head coach after their comprehensive 16-0 Ashes defeat this year.A whitewash in Australia was always likely to prompt a change in the hierarchy, with Lewis leaving a little over two years on from his appointment in November 2022. author: Taha Hashim

title: Australia beat New Zealand by eight wickets: first women‚Äôs T20 international ‚Äì as it happened
description: Beth Mooney unbeaten on 75 in her 200th international Georgia Voll chips in with 50 to guide visitors to victory3rd over: New Zealand 20-0 (Bates 14, Plimmer 6) Megan Schutt turns to her bag of tricks to fight back with a clever over to Bates. The New Zealand opener is looking to be aggressive at any opportunity, whether stepping down the track or moving outside the line to target the area behind the keeper. But Schutt‚Äôs variety has the better of her with five dot balls and only a couple conceded over midwicket.2nd over: New Zealand 18-0 (Bates 12, Plimmer 6) Australia turn to spin with Ash Gardner taking the new ball. Georgia Plimmer is straight onto the back foot to find a gap behind point for a couple, then dances down the pitch to loft Gardner back over her head to the rope. New Zealand are targeting the short boundaries well. Continue reading...
author: Martin Pegan
